channel.title: reflection on Zoe Liao
channel.description: Recent content in reflection on Zoe Liao

item.title: Similarities between Pharmacy and Data Science
item.description: General experiences from pharmacy that can translate to data science: 1. Accuracy/Meticulousness I wouldn’t say I’m a naturally detail-oriented person, but being meticulous is required in pharmacy to ensure safe patient care. Some tasks that are done routinely that require accuracy are: checking the prescription label – making sure it’s for the right patient, safe with other medications and medical conditions, correct dose and route of administration distinguishing between look-alike, sound-alike drugs (Cerebyx vs Celebrex, lamivudine vs lamotrigine, etc) when both transcribing and dispensing compounding medications – making sure you are using the appropriate diluent and concentration of drugs, with accurate labeling and storage Accurately assessing data and interpreting the results is important.

item.title: What I Learned About Myself While Studying Data Science
item.description: Here’s what I’ve learned about myself during the bootcamp: 1. I cannot be a perfectionist. I quickly learned you can’t predict what you kind of problems you will run into, especially as a beginner. When I first started the bootcamp, I wanted to have a clear idea of how long things would take and be able to plan my schedule/project approach accordingly. However, I soon learned that data science is an iterative process, and unpredictable.
